00078 /*! \page page_spec_introduction Introduction
00079   
00080   The OpenCores aoOCS SoC is a Wishbone compatible implementation of most of the Amiga Original Chip Set (OCS) and computer functionality.
00081  
00082   aoOCS is not related in any way with Minimig - it is a new and independent Amiga OCS implementation.
00083  
00084   <h3>Features</h3>
00085    - The aoOCS SoC contains the following Amiga/OCS components:
00086        - blitter
00087        - copper
00088        - system control (interrupts)
00089        - video: bitplains, sprites, collision detection
00090        - audio: 4 channels, low-pass filter
00091        - user input: PS/2 mouse, PS/2 keyboard and joystick (keyboard arrow keys)
00092        - floppy: read and write ADF files directly from a SD card. Only the internal floppy drive is implemented
00093        - 8520 CIA
00094        - ao68000 OpenCores IP core is used as the aoOCS processor
00095    - All of the above components are WISHBONE revision B.3 compatible
00096    - The aoOCS contains the following additional components:
00097        - SD card controller written in HDL with DMA. Supports SDHC cards only.
00098        - 10/100 Mbit Ethernet controller written in HDL to send the current VGA frames (frame grabber)
00099        - HDL drivers for SSRAM, PS/2 keyboard, PS/2 mouse, audio codec, VGA DAC
00100    - aoOCS uses only one external memory: a SSRAM with 36-bit words and pipelined access. A video buffer with about 250KB is located SSRAM. Another 256KB are used by the ROM. All the rest memory
00101      can be used as Chip RAM.
00102    - The On-Screen-Display is implemented in HDL as a finite state machine. No additional controller/processor with firmware required to handle the SoC.
00103    - The following options are available on the On-Screen-Display:
00104        - select ROM file to load (only Amiga Kickstart v1.2 was tested)
00105        - enable or disable Joystick (keyboard arrow keys)
00106        - enable or disable floppy write protection
00107        - insert a floppy - select one from a list
00108        - eject an inserted floppy
00109        - reset the system
00110    - The On-Screen-Display is independent of the running Amiga software. It is enabled and disabled by the Home key and controled by the keyboard arrow keys and the right CTRL key.
00111    - Only PAL timings are implemented. 
00112    - The video output is VGA compatible: 640x480 at 70 Hz. A rather simple method is used to extend the 256 PAL horizontal lines to 480 VGA lines: all lines are doubled except for every 8th one.
00113    - The system uses generally a single clock: 30 MHz. There are two more clocks: 12 MHz, 25 MHz generated to interface with external hardware (Audio codec, Ethernet controller). A single altpll is used
00114      to generate all three clocks from one 50 MHz external clock. More information about clocks is available at \ref page_spec_clocks.
00115    - A VGA frame grabber is implemented that sends captured frames by 100 Mbit Ethernet in IP/UDP packets. 
00116    - The system uses about 26.400 LE on Altera Cyclone II and about 267.000 bits of on-chip RAM.
00117    - The blitter functionality was tested against the E-UAE Amiga software emulator.
00118    - Tested only on a Terasic DE2-70 board (www.terasic.com.tw).
00119    - Documentation generated by Doxygen (www.doxygen.org) with doxverilog patch (http://developer.berlios.de/projects/doxverilog/). The specification
00120      is automatically extracted from the Doxygen HTML output.
00121  
00122   <h3>WISHBONE compatibility</h3>
00123    - Version: WISHBONE specification Revision B.3,
00124    - General description: 32-bit WISHBONE interface,
00125    - WISHBONE data port size: 32-bit,
00126    - Data port granularity: 8-bits,
00127    - Data port maximum operand size: 32-bits,
00128    - Data transfer ordering: BIG ENDIAN,
00129    - Data transfer sequencing: UNDEFINED, 
00130    - Constraints on <tt>CLK_I</tt> signal: described in \ref page_spec_clocks.
00131  
00132   <h3>Similar projects</h3>
00133   Other Open-Source Amiga implementations include:
00134    - Minimig (http://code.google.com/p/minimig/) - FPGA-based re-implementation of the original Amiga 500 hardware. Runs on the Minimig PCB and also on Terasic DE1,2 boards.
00135  
00136   <h3>Limitations</h3>
00137    - No filesystem support on the SD card. Data is read from fixed positions. The contents of the SD card is generated by the <tt>aoOCS_tool</tt> described at \ref page_spec_operation.
00138    - No video external synchronize, lace mode, lightpen, genlock audio enable, color composite (BPLCON0)
00139    - All bitplain data is fetched at once in a burst memory read at the begining of each line. No changes to the bitplain data done after the beginning of a line are visible.
00140    - Currently aoOCS requires an 36-bit word SSRAM to store the video buffer. This way 3 pixels 12-bits each can be stored in one word.
00141    - Serial port not implemented.
00142    - Parallel  port not implemented.
00143    - Low-pass filter disable/enable by CIA-A port A bit 1 not implemented.
00144    - Proportional controller and light pen not implemented.
00145    - Some rarely used OCS registers are not implemented: strobe video sync, write beam position, coprocessor instruction fetch identify. For a complete list of not implemented
00146      registers look at \ref page_spec_registers.
00147    - Only some of the Amiga software was tested and works on the aoOCS. A list of aoOCS software compatability is located at \ref page_spec_operation.
00148  
00149   <h3>TODO</h3> 
00150    - Fix some of the above limitations.
00151    - Optimize the design.
00152    - Run WISHBONE verification models.
00153    - More documentation of Verilog sources.
00154    - Describe testing and changes done in E-UAE sources.
00155    - Prepare scripts for VATS: run_sim -r -> regresion test.
00156    - Port the aoOCS SoC to a Xilinx FPGA.
00157  
00158   <h3>Status</h3>
00159   - Amiga Workbench v1.2 runs with some minor graphic problems:  bottom of screen not displayed correctly.
00160   - Prince of Persia runs perfectly.
00161   - Wings of Fury runs correctly. Some sound glitches in intro.
00162   - Lotus 2 runs correctly. Some sound problems in intro.
00163   - Warzone runs poor. Some major graphic problems.
00164   - More information about aoOCS software compatability is available at \ref page_spec_operation.
00165  
00166   <h3>Requirements</h3>
00167    - Altera Quartus II synthesis tool (http://www.altera.com) is required to synthesise the <tt>aoOCS</tt> System-on-Chip.
00168    - Java SDK (http://java.sun.com) is required to compile the <tt>aoOCS_tool</tt> (The tool is described in \ref page_spec_operation).
00169    - A FPGA board. Currently only the Terasic DE2-70 board was tested. 
00170    - Icarus Verilog simulator (http://www.icarus.com/eda/verilog/) is required to compile the and run some tests.
00171    - Access to Altera Quartus II directory (directory eda/sim_lib/) is required to compile and run some tests.
00172    - GCC (http://gcc.gnu.org) is required to compile some testes based on E-UAE sources.
00173  */
00174

00244 /*! \page page_spec_operation Operation
00245  
00246   <h3>SD card</h3>
00247   The aoOCS SoC requires a SD card containing a list of available ROMs and floppy images together with images themselves. The aoOCS does not support any filesystem on the card.
00248   A binary image file must be prepared and written on the card starting at sector 0. The aoOCS_tool is used to prepare the image in the following way:
00249   - a title screen PNG image must be available. A default image is available at \c ./sw/aoOCS_tool/title.png
00250   - a directory with ROM files must be created
00251   - a directory with floppy images (ADF files) must be created
00252   - the following \c make command must be run at the base directory of the project:
00253   \verbatim
00254   make sd_disk AO_INTRO_IMAGE=<path to title screen PNG image> AO_ROMS=<path to ROMs directory> AO_FLOPPIES=<path to floppy images directory>
00255   \endverbatim
00256   - The SD disk image is generated and saved to \c ./tmp/sd_disk.img. That image must be written directly on a SD disk bypassing and most probably destroying the filesystem on the disk.
00257     The easiest way to write the image is to run the \c dd command as a super-user on a Linux system:
00258   \verbatim
00259   dd if=<path to image file> of=<path to SD device>
00260   \endverbatim
00261  
00262   <h3>aoOCS_tool</h3>
00263   The aoOCS_tool is used to:
00264   - Create the contents of the SD card. A image containing: a title screen, ROMs and floppy disk ADF files is created. This image has to be written to the SD
00265     card starting from sector 0.
00266   - Extract vga frames from the drv_eth_vga_capture module as PNG images.
00267   - Generate <tt>./rtl/control_osd.mif</tt> memory initialization file with On-Screen-Display text strings.
00268   - Extract the specification contents from Doxygen HTML output, to generate the specification ODT file.
00269  
00270   The source code for the tool is located at: <tt>./sw/aoOCS_tool/</tt>.
00271  
00272   <h3>On-Screen-Display description</h3>
00273   - After powerup or reset, the SoC tries to initialize the SD card and read the title screen, list of ROM files and list of floppy files. If all goes well, the following screen is displayed:
00274   \image html vga_title.png "aoOCS title screen with ROM selection menu"
00275  
00276   - The On-Screen-Display is controlled by the keyboard arrow Up and Down keys. To select an item use the right Control key:
00277   \image html vga_menu_sel_wb.png "aoOCS floppy selection menu with Amiga Workbench 1.2 floppy highlighted"
00278  
00279   - After selecting the ROM file, the menu disappears and the Amiga boots from the ROM:
00280   \image html vga_kick12.png "Amiga Kickstart v1.2 bootstrap screen"
00281  
00282   - To select a floppy disk to insert into the internal disk drive, the On-Screen-Display is used. To display the menu press the Home key. The Home key is also used to hide the menu.
00283     The menu when no floppy is inserted looks like this:
00284   \image html vga_menu_no_floppy.png "aoOCS floppy selection menu"
00285  
00286   - The following options are available:
00287        - <tt>Joystick (kbd arrows)</tt>: enable or disable the joystick on Amiga port 1. The joystick is controlled by the keyboard arrow keys and the right Control key. When enabled, the
00288          arrow keys are unavailable to the Amiga keyboard - the key strokes are redirected to the joystick.
00289        - <tt>Floppy write enabled</tt>: enable or disable floppy writes. The floppy changes are made directly on the SD disk.
00290        - <tt>Reset</tt>: reset the aoOCS SoC
00291        - Below is a list of available floppy disks to insert. After selecting a floppy the display changes to the following:
00292   \image html vga_menu_floppy_inserted.png "aoOCS menu after floppy selection"
00293   - In this menu it is possible to eject the floppy disk. After ejecting the floppy the previous menu is dispayed.
00294  
00295   <h3>Software compatability list</h3>
00296   The state of software can be:
00297   <table border=0>
00298   <tr><td><i>PERFECT</i> </td><td> no visible and no audible distortions</td></tr>
00299   <tr><td><i>GOOD</i>    </td><td> some minor distortions</td></tr>
00300   <tr><td><i>FAIR</i>    </td><td> software starts but has major distortions</td></tr>
00301   <tr><td><i>FAILED</i>  </td><td> software does not start</td></tr>
00302   </table>
00303  
00304   - Amiga Workbench version 1.2
00305   <div align="center"><table width="100%"><tr><td width=300>
00306        <table>
00307        <tr><td><b>aoOCS version:</b> </td><td> 1.0         </td></td></tr>
00308        <tr><td><b>State:</b>         </td><td><i>GOOD</i>  </td></tr>
00309        <tr><td><b>Description:</b>   </td><td>
00310   Some minor graphic problems: bottom of screen not displayed correctly. Most probably problem with Copper and vertical beam position.
00311        </td></tr></table>
00312   </td><td>
00313   \image html vga_wb12.png "Amiga Workbench v1.2 screen"
00314   </td></tr></table></div>
00315  
00316   - Prince of Persia
00317   <div align="center"><table width="100%"><tr><td width=300>
00318        <table>
00319        <tr><td><b>aoOCS version:</b> </td><td> 1.0         </td></td></tr>
00320        <tr><td><b>State:</b>         </td><td><i>PERFECT</i>  </td></tr>
00321        <tr><td><b>Description:</b>   </td><td>
00322   No problems.
00323        </td></tr></table>
00324   </td><td>
00325   \image html vga_prince_of_persia.png "Prince of Persia"
00326   </td></tr></table></div>
00327  
00328   - Wings of Fury
00329   <div align="center"><table width="100%"><tr><td width=300>
00330        <table>
00331        <tr><td><b>aoOCS version:</b> </td><td> 1.0         </td></td></tr>
00332        <tr><td><b>State:</b>         </td><td><i>GOOD</i>  </td></tr>
00333        <tr><td><b>Description:</b>   </td><td>
00334   Some sound gliches in introduction. The game itself works perfect.
00335        </td></tr></table>
00336   </td><td>
00337   \image html vga_wings_of_fury.png "Wing of Fury"
00338   </td></tr></table></div>
00339  
00340   - Lotus 2
00341   <div align="center"><table width="100%"><tr><td width=300>
00342        <table>
00343        <tr><td><b>aoOCS version:</b> </td><td> 1.0         </td></td></tr>
00344        <tr><td><b>State:</b>         </td><td><i>GOOD</i>  </td></tr>
00345        <tr><td><b>Description:</b>   </td><td>
00346   Some minor sound problems in introduction - most probably some bug in the low-pass filter or channel modulation. The VGA frame was captured in the middle of screen update
00347   so there are some distortions. In real-time in looks OK.
00348        </td></tr></table>
00349   </td><td>
00350   \image html vga_lotus2.png "Lotus 2"
00351   </td></tr></table></div>
00352  
00353   - Warzone
00354   <div align="center"><table width="100%"><tr><td width=300>
00355        <table>
00356        <tr><td><b>aoOCS version:</b> </td><td> 1.0         </td></td></tr>
00357        <tr><td><b>State:</b>         </td><td><i>FAIR</i>  </td></tr>
00358        <tr><td><b>Description:</b>   </td><td>
00359   Major graphic problems - as seen on captured VGA frame. 
00360        </td></tr></table>
00361   </td><td>
00362   \image html vga_warzone.png "Warzone"
00363   </td></tr></table></div>
00364  */

00366 /*! \page page_spec_registers Registers
00367 
00368 List of not implemented OCS registers:
00369 
00370 \b ocs_control
00371 \verbatim
00372     STREQU    & *038  S   D       Strobe for horiz sync with VB and EQU
00373     STRVBL    & *03A  S   D       Strobe for horiz sync with VB (vert. blank)
00374     STRHOR    & *03C  S   DP      Strobe for horiz sync
00375     STRLONG   & *03E  S   D( E )  Strobe for identification of long horiz. line.
00376     VHPOSW      *02C  W   A       Write vert and horiz position of beam
00377 \endverbatim
00378 
00379 \b ocs_input
00380 \verbatim
00381     POT0DAT     *012  R   P( E )  Pot counter pair 0 data (vert,horiz)
00382     POT1DAT     *014  R   P( E )  Pot counter pair 1 data (vert,horiz)
00383     POTGOR      *016  R   P       Pot port data read (formerly POTINP)
00384     POTGO       *034  W   P       Pot port data write and start
00385 \endverbatim
00386 
00387 \b ocs_copper
00388 \verbatim
00389     COPINS       08C  W   A       Coprocessor instruction fetch identify
00390 \endverbatim
00391 
00392 \b ocs_serial
00393 \verbatim
00394     SERDATR     *018  R   P       Serial port data and status read
00395     SERDAT      *030  W   P       Serial port data and stop bits write
00396     SERPER      *032  W   P       Serial port period and control
00397 \endverbatim
00398 
00399 \b ocs_floppy
00400 \verbatim
00401     DSKDATR   & *008  ER  P       Disk data early read (dummy address)
00402 \endverbatim
00403 
00404 \b ocs_blitter
00405 \verbatim
00406    BLTDDAT   & *000  ER  A       Blitter destination early read (dummy address)
00407 \endverbatim
00408 */
00409 
00410 /*! \page page_spec_clocks Clocks
00411   <table width=100%>
00412   <caption><b>Table 1:</b> List of clocks.</caption>
00413   <tr style="background: #CCCCCC; font-weight: bold;">
00414       <td rowspan=2>Name</td><td rowspan=2>Source</td><td colspan=3>Rates (MHz)</td><td rowspan=2>Remarks</td><td rowspan=2>Description</td></tr>
00415   <tr style="background: #CCCCCC; font-weight: bold;">
00416       <td>Max</td><td>Min</td><td>Resolution</td></tr>
00417  
00418   <tr><td>clk_50</td><td>Input Port</td><td>50</td><td>50</td><td>-</td><td>-</td><td>External input clock. Used only as input to altpll.</td></tr>
00419   <tr><td>clk_30</td><td>altpll output</td><td>30</td><td>30</td><td>-</td><td>-</td><td>Main system clock.</td></tr>
00420   <tr><td>clk_12</td><td>altpll output</td><td>12</td><td>12</td><td>-</td><td>-</td><td>Used only in drv_audio to clock the WM8731 audio codec hardware.</td></tr>
00421   <tr><td>clk_25</td><td>altpll output</td><td>25</td><td>25</td><td>-</td><td>-</td><td>Used only in drv_eth_vga_capture to clock the DM9000A Ethernet hardware.</td></tr>
00422   </table>
00423  */
00424 
00425 /*! \page page_spec_ports IO Ports
00426   <h3>aoOCS top-level IO Ports</h3>
00427 \verbatim
00428 Inputs
00429     Clock and reset
00430         clk_50      
00431         reset_ext_n     
00432     DM9000A Ethernet hardware interface
00433         enet_irq    
00434     Switches and hex leds hardware interface from drv_debug
00435         debug_sw1_pc    
00436         debug_sw2_adr   
00437         debug_sw3_halt      
00438 Inouts
00439     IS61LPS51236A pipelined SSRAM hardware interface
00440         ssram_data          [35:0]
00441     SD bus 1-bit hardware interface
00442         sd_cmd_io   
00443         sd_dat_io   
00444     PS/2 keyboard hardware interface
00445         ps2_kbclk   
00446         ps2_kbdat   
00447     PS/2 mouse hardware interface
00448         ps2_mouseclk    
00449         ps2_mousedat    
00450     WM8731 audio codec hardware interface
00451         ac_sdat     
00452     DM9000A Ethernet hardware interface
00453         enet_data           [15:0]
00454 Outputs
00455     IS61LPS51236A pipelined SSRAM hardware interface
00456         ssram_address       [18:0]
00457         ssram_oe_n      
00458         ssram_writeen_n     
00459         ssram_byteen_n      [3:0]
00460         ssram_clk   
00461         ssram_globalw_n     
00462         ssram_advance_n     
00463         ssram_adsp_n    
00464         ssram_adsc_n    
00465         ssram_ce1_n     
00466         ssram_ce2   
00467         ssram_ce3_n     
00468     SD bus 1-bit hardware interface
00469         sd_clk_o    
00470     ADV7123 Video DAC hardware interface
00471         vga_r   [9:0]
00472         vga_g   [9:0]
00473         vga_b   [9:0]
00474         vga_blank_n     
00475         vga_sync_n      
00476         vga_clock   
00477         vga_hsync   
00478         vga_vsync   
00479     WM8731 audio codec hardware interface
00480         ac_sclk     
00481         ac_xclk     
00482         ac_bclk     
00483         ac_dat      
00484         ac_lr   
00485     DM9000A Ethernet hardware interface
00486         enet_clk_25     
00487         enet_reset_n    
00488         enet_cs_n   
00489         enet_ior_n      
00490         enet_iow_n      
00491         enet_cmd    
00492     Switches and hex leds hardware interface from drv_debug
00493         hex0                [7:0]
00494         hex1                [7:0]
00495         hex2                [7:0]
00496         hex3                [7:0]
00497         hex4                [7:0]
00498         hex5                [7:0]
00499         hex6                [7:0]
00500         hex7                [7:0]
00501     Leds hardware interface for debug purposes
00502         debug_sd            [7:0]
00503         debug_68k_state     [7:0]
00504         debug_floppy        [7:0]
00505 \endverbatim
00506  */
